title: The introduction of a formal methodology for the supply of Metal, Sand, Soil and Gravel required for the development activities of the Government
decision_details:
- A high demand has been created for minerals such as metal, sand, soil and gravel etc; required for the development of infrastructure facilities presently carried out in Sri Lanka. As such, the importance of having a formal methodology for the supply of such minerals for the development activities of the Government with the least possible environmental effects in excavating of these minerals, has been emphasized. 

Accordingly, the proposal made by Maithripala Sirisena, H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, for the introduction of a formal methodology for the excavation of minerals found in the areas administered by the Sri Lanka Mahaweli Authority and the Department of Forest Conservation and for the protection of environment conservation, eliminating corruption, fraud and irregularities for ensuring an effective supply chain after a proper environmental assessment for the expeditious implementation of the development projects at a minimum cost  with a view to achieving sustainable development,  was approved by the Cabinet.
